comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content: This photo was taken on August 1, 1943, at Lambert Airport (STL / KSTL) in St. Louis. From left to right, they are Mayor of St. Louis, William D. Becker, Thomas Dysart (President, St. Louis Chamber of Commerce), Judge Henry Mueller, Lieut. Colonel Paul Hazelton, and Max Doyne (Director of Public Utilities). These men, and five others - including William B. Robertson, the founder of St. Louis-based Robertson Aircraft Corporation (RAC) (and the builders of the WACO CG-4A troop transport glider pictured), are about to plunge to their deaths during a public demonstration flight. See: books.google.com/books?id=RVAEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA30&lp...

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content:
Per TVL1970:
This photo was taken on August 1, 1943, at Lambert Airport (STL / KSTL) in St. Louis. 

From left to right, they are Mayor of St. Louis, William D. Becker, Thomas Dysart (President, St. Louis Chamber of Commerce), Judge Henry Mueller, Lieut. Colonel Paul Hazelton, and Max Doyne (Director of Public Utilities). These men, and five others - including William B. Robertson, the founder of St. Louis-based Robertson Aircraft Corporation (RAC) (and the builders of the WACO CG-4A troop transport glider pictured), are about to plunge to their deaths during a public demonstration flight. 

See:
books.google.com/books?id=RVAEAAAAMBAJ&pg =PA30&lp...

Thanks, TVL1970
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/25695066@N00] OH NO!  Not a happy end....
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: Yes, correct.  A famous and chilling image.  I think there are pictures of the glider plunging to earth with one wing missing.
